Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2013 05:58AM debbiema wrote: Had my MRI yesterday.  Results are back with the lone mass in my left breast, however, they indicated that their is a midly prominent lymph node in the axillary.  It doesn't look suspicisous and no bioposed requested.  Of course I'm panicked that it already spread and I'm just sick to my stomach.  Meet with BS on Tuesday to go over everythign including next steps.  Anyone else have advice on the axillary node??
Posts.Title: MRI kk12903 meghar

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2013 12:49AM debbiema wrote: Please hang in there.  I am a widow and have two children ages 7 and 10.  I finished my last round of TC on July 17th!  I got through it and am getting through it.  You will see that others want to help you and you need to take their help.  You will find that you have more strength than you ever imagined!  Stay strong!
Posts.Title: Mother of 3 - starting chemo 7/24...how do I do this? Jserenityb0413 debbiema

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2013 10:37AM debbiema wrote: Awesome and such an inspirational post.  I am going in for my MRI today after being diagnosed a couple weeks ago.  I'm scared everyday as I am a widow (husband died of pancreatic cancer in 2010) with 2 young children.  I will feel better when I am truly in the fight.  Need to decide on lump or masc.  Will see what the MRI brings and go from there.  So far ER & PR+, HER-.  Stay tuned and thank you so much for your words of wisdom!
Posts.Title: 29-ish Months Post-Diagnosis: You Will Get Through This! Kaidog MNSusan
